articles.title: Floral Tribute Paid to Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Floral Tribute Paid to Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
 Pyongyang, June 28 (KCNA) -- Senior party, state and army officials including Kim Yong Nam, Hwang Pyong So, Pak Pong Ju and Choe Ryong Hae, and deputies to take part in the Fourth Session of the 13th Supreme People's Assembly visited the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill Tuesday. 
					 They laid a floral basket and bunches of flowers before the statues of the peerlessly great men and paid tribute to them.

articles.title: Deputies to SPA Visit Construction Site of Ryomyong Street
articles.content:
Deputies to SPA Visit Construction Site of Ryomyong Street
 Pyongyang, June 28 (KCNA) -- Deputies to take part in the Fourth Session of the 13th Supreme People's Assembly visited the construction site of Ryomyong Street Tuesday.
					 Witnessing the street which has taken shape of new modern street in just several months since the ground-breaking, they encouraged builders to perform feats in the construction project.
					
					 They handed over aid materials to builders and worked with them, requesting them to make new innovations in the construction to display again the invincible tradition of Juche Korea.

articles.title: Pak Pong Ju Makes Field Survey of Different Units in North Phyongan Province
articles.content:
Pak Pong Ju Makes Field Survey of Different Units in North Phyongan Province
 Pyongyang, June 28 (KCNA) -- DPRK Premier Pak Pong Ju made a field survey of different units in North Phyongan Province.
					 Looking round the paper workshop of the Sinuiju Chemical Fiber Mill, the knitting yarn workshop of the Sinuiju Textile Mill and the Phungnyon-pit of the Phungnyon Mine, he learned in detail about how the assignments of the 200-day campaign and daily quotas are being honored by the relevant units. Then he convened a consultative meeting. 
					
					 It underscored the important duties the relevant factories and a big base for producing apatite have to perform for improving the people's living standard.
					
					 The meeting discussed the issue of achieving the same signal successes as what done during the 70-day campaign by supplying sufficient quantities of electricity and coal, the issue of adjusting and reinforcing cutting faces while concentrating efforts on earth-scraping, the issue of locally producing mining equipment and the issue of establishing cultured practice in production and life at a high level as required by a highly civilized socialist nation. It took steps for solving them.
					
					 Meanwhile, the premier visited the Ponghwa Chemical Factory where he referred to the importance of establishing the energy saving production processes. He discussed the issues of strengthening the independence and Juche character of national economy.
					
					 Earlier, he made a field survey of the construction site of the medical oxygen factory and Okryu Children's Hospital.

articles.title: Special Envoy of First Secretary of C.C., CPC Here
articles.content:
Special Envoy of First Secretary of C.C., CPC Here
 Pyongyang, June 28 (KCNA) -- Salvador Antonio Valdes Mesa, member of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Cuba (CPC) and vice-president of the Council of State of Cuba, and his party arrived here on Tuesday to visit the DPRK as a special envoy of Raul Castro Ruz, first secretary of the C.C., CPC.

articles.title: Special Envoy of First Secretary of C.C., CPC Pays Tribute to Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Special Envoy of First Secretary of C.C., CPC Pays Tribute to Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
 Pyongyang, June 28 (KCNA) -- Salvador Antonio Valdes Mesa, member of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Cuba (CPC) and vice-president of the Council of State of Cuba, on a visit to the DPRK as a special envoy of Raul Castro Ruz, first secretary of the C.C., CPC, visited the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill on Tuesday. 
					 Present there were the special envoy's party and staff members of the Cuban Embassy here.
					
					 They laid a floral basket before the statues of the great leaders and paid tribute to them.

articles.title: Choe Ryong Hae Meets Special Envoy of First Secretary of C.C., CPC
articles.content:
Choe Ryong Hae Meets Special Envoy of First Secretary of C.C., CPC
 Pyongyang, June 28 (KCNA) -- Choe Ryong Hae, member of the Presidium of the Political Bureau and vice-chairman of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, met with Salvador Antonio Valdes Mesa, member of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Cuba (CPC) and vice-president of the Council of State of Cuba, and his party on a visit to the DPRK as a special envoy of Raul Castro Ruz, first secretary of the C.C., CPC, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Tuesday.
					 Salvador Antonio Valdes Mesa in detail informed Choe Ryong Hae of the Seventh Congress of the CPC.

articles.title: WPK Central Committee Gives Reception for Special Envoy of First Secretary of C.C., CPC
articles.content:
WPK Central Committee Gives Reception for Special Envoy of First Secretary of C.C., CPC
 Pyongyang, June 28 (KCNA) -- The Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) gave a reception Tuesday in honor of a special envoy of the first secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China (CPC) and his party.
					 Present there on invitation were Salvador Antonio Valdes Mesa, member of the Political Bureau of the C.C., CPC and vice-president of the Council of State of Cuba, and his party on a visit to the DPRK as a special envoy of Raul Castro Ruz, first secretary of the C.C., CPC, and staff members of the Cuban Embassy here.
					
					 Present there were Ri Su Yong, member of the Political Bureau and vice-chairman of the C.C., WPK, Ri Chang Gun, vice department director of the C.C., WPK, Sin Hong Chol, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, Ri Kwang Gun, vice-minister of External Economic Relations, and officials concerned.
					
					 Ri Su Yong in a speech said that the great Comrade Kim Il Sung and Comrade Kim Jong Il together with respected Comrade Fidel Castro Ruz and Comrade Raul Castro Ruz provided the traditional relations of friendship and cooperation between the two parties and two countries.
					
					 He wholeheartedly wished the Cuban party and people greater successes in the drive to defend socialism, the gains of revolution, and implement the decision of the Seventh Congress of the CPC under the leadership of Raul Castro Ruz.
					
					 He said that the DPRK will in the future, too, make positive efforts to steadily develop the traditional relations of friendship and cooperation with the Cuban party and people, true to the noble intention of the respected Comrade Kim Jong Un, chairman of the WPK.
					
					 Salvador Antonio Valdes Mesa in a speech said that the great Comrade Kim Il Sung and Comrade Kim Jong Il extended firm support and solidarity to the Cuban people whenever they suffered difficulties and ordeals, and the respected Comrade Kim Jong Un is now invariably carrying forward the cause of the preceding leaders.
					
					 The Seventh Congress of the CPC stressed again the will not to give up socialism but develop it in a sustainable manner and continue developing the relations of solidarity with all countries which have supported the Cuban revolution traditionally and historically, he noted.
					
					 Expressing belief that the current visit would serve as a significant occasion for further developing the traditional relations of friendship between the two countries, he noted that Cuba would develop the relations with the fraternal Korean people in the future, too.

articles.title: Briefing on Situation on Korean Peninsula Given for Diplomatic Envoys Here from Asian Countries
articles.content:
Briefing on Situation on Korean Peninsula Given for Diplomatic Envoys Here from Asian Countries 
 Pyongyang, June 28 (KCNA) -- The Foreign Ministry of the DPRK organized a briefing on the recent situation on the Korean peninsula for diplomatic envoys here from Asian countries Tuesday.
					 Present there were ambassadors of Laos, Cambodia, Malaysia, Indonesia, Iran and India to the DPRK and charges d'affaires a.i. of the Mongolian, Vietnamese and Pakistani embassies here.
					
					 Choe Hui Chol, director general of the Asian and Oceanian Department of the DPRK Foreign Ministry, informed them of the principled stand of the DPRK on the recent situation on the Korean peninsula.
					
					 He said that recently the U.S. opened to public the plan for "precision air raid operations" against nuclear facilities and nuclear force of the DPRK and introduced strategic assets including nuclear-powered submarine Mississippi into and around the Korean peninsula, driving its situation to an extreme phase.
					
					 The main cause of the tension on the Korean peninsula is attributable to the U.S. perverted view, he said, adding that this time, too, the U.S. made a very rash and strategically wrong decision, he noted, and went on:
					
					 The supreme interests of the state are threatened and the situation is led to the uncontrollable phase due to the U.S. ceaseless arms-buildup. Under this situation the DPRK will in future, too, continue to hold higher the banner of simultaneous development of the two fronts, bolster the capabilities for preemptive nuclear attack in a sustainable manner, continue to develop strategic attack weapons with diverse missions and deploy them for an actual war.
					
					 The Asian countries should clearly understand that the chief culprit escalating tension on the Korean peninsula and compelling the DPRK to constantly bolster physical deterrence is none other than the U.S., and do things helpful to the detente on the Korean peninsula.
					
					 The briefing on the situation served as an important occasion for helping diplomatic envoys here from Asian countries have deep understanding that the U.S. bellicose and hideous moves for threatening and blackmailing the DPRK with nuclear weapons become a root cause of escalating tension on the Korean peninsula.

articles.title: U.S.-Japan-S. Korea Missile Warning Drill Termed Another Military Provocation against DPRK
articles.content:
U.S.-Japan-S. Korea Missile Warning Drill Termed Another Military Provocation against DPRK
 Pyongyang, June 28 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Disarmament and Peace Institute of the DPRK Foreign Ministry Tuesday gave the following answer to the question put by KCNA as regards the military provocation perpetrated by the U.S. against the DPRK together with Japan and south Korean puppet forces:
					 On Tuesday the U.S. staged a missile warning drill in the waters near Hawaii together with Japan and the south Korean puppet forces under the pretext of coping with "nuclear and missile threat" from the DPRK.
					
					 The drill staged in the Pacific Ocean was another military provocation against the DPRK and a revelation of their hegemonic scenario for disturbing regional peace and security.
					
					 The U.S. recently opened to the public the hideous plan for "precision air raid operation" aimed to "disable" nuclear facilities and strategic means of the DPRK and introduced nuclear-powered submarine Mississippi and a formation of B-52H strategic bombers into south Korea. The anti-DPRK joint military drill staged in the wake of these military moves clearly proves once again who is chiefly to blame for the tense situation on the Korean peninsula.
					
					 What should not be overlooked is that the U.S., Japan and south Korea openly started the provocative triangular joint military exercise, the first of its kind in history.
					
					 The U.S. missile defense system which is being translated into reality in the Asia-Pacific region and the appearance of NATO of Asian version with the U.S.-Japan-south Korean triangular military alliance as a mother body are not a long way off, and it will inevitably spark off a new arms race and a new Cold War in Northeast Asia surrounding the Korean peninsula.
					
					 Herein lies the danger of the above-said drill.
					
					 The reality goes to prove that very just are the line and policy of the Workers' Party of Korea and the state on further bolstering up the self-defensive nuclear deterrence both in quality and quantity.
					
					 It is the consistent stand of the DPRK to defend the peace and security in the region and the rest of the world by dint of Songun.
					
					 Now that the U.S. and other hostile forces are posing constant threat to the security of the DPRK and the region by frequently staging joint military exercises, the army and people of the DPRK will bolster in a sustainable manner the capabilities for preemptive nuclear attack to pose a constant threat to the enemies, and put spurs to research and development of diverse strategic attack weapons.

articles.title: Int'l Day of Yoga Marked
articles.content:
Int'l Day of Yoga Marked
 Pyongyang, June 28 (KCNA) -- A briefing on the International Day of Yoga took place at the Taedonggang Diplomatic Club on Tuesday under the sponsorship of the Indian Embassy in Pyongyang.
					 Invited there were Kim Hyong Hun, vice-minister of Public Health, officials concerned and diplomatic envoys and representatives of international bodies here.
					
					 Indian Ambassador to the DPRK Jasminder Kasturia and staff members of the embassy took part in the briefing.
					
					 The participants listened to the explanation about Yoga, which is being widely spread in India and different countries as health exercise.
					
					 They watched the demonstration of Yoga.

articles.title: Ethiopian Delegation Pays Tribute to Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Ethiopian Delegation Pays Tribute to Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
 Pyongyang, June 28 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Addis Ababa Youth Association of Ethiopia headed by President Gelta Ermiyas Mathewos visited the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill on Tuesday.
					 Members of the delegation laid a bouquet before the statues of the great leaders and paid tribute to them.

articles.title: Royal Tombs Unearthed in DPRK
articles.content:
Royal Tombs Unearthed in DPRK
 Pyongyang, June 28 (KCNA) -- Two royal tombs dating back to the Koryo Kingdom (918-1392) were recently unearthed in the area of Kaesong City, the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.
					 According to Dr. Ri Chang Jin of the Archaeological Institute of the Academy of Social Sciences, the tombs stand apart 250 meters from each other in the east and west of the southern slope of Mae Peak, 4 kilometers away from the northeast of Haeson-ri seat, Kaesong City. 
					
					 There is the Mausoleum of King Wang Kon in the seat, he said, and went on:
					
					 The tombs were pillaged and got considerably damaged by the Japanese imperialists long ago.
					
					 Each tomb area with a granite terrace is divided into three plots.
					
					 Tomb No. 1 is covered with five big plate stones. And its chamber with well-trimmed granite walls is 3.7 meters from north to south, 3 meters from east to west and 1.65 to 1.73 meters high.
					
					 Tomb No. 2 has also well-trimmed granite walls and is covered with 13 plate stones beamed by two great stones. Its chamber is 3.56 meters from north to south, 3.38 meters from east to west and 2.2 meters high.
					
					 Remains unearthed in the chambers include gilt-bronze arrowhead, gilt-bronze plaque, silver ornaments and fragments of Koryo celadon.
					
					 Seen in the second plots of the tomb Nos. 1 and 2 are four stone sculptures representing civil officials, two on each side, and two stone sculptures of the same kind, one on each side, respectively.
					
					 The third plots are considered to be assigned for places for memorial service.
					
					 Those tombs have the same exterior architectural style as mausoleums of Koryo Kingdom like the Mausoleum of King Wang Kon, the founder of Koryo Kingdom.
					
					 On the basis of archeological data and old document "History of Koryo Dynasty", it was confirmed that the tomb Nos. 1 and 2 are mausoleums of the 9th and 10th kings of Koryo Kingdom.

articles.title: Voice of Survivor of U.S. Wartime Atrocity
articles.content:
Voice of Survivor of U.S. Wartime Atrocity
 Pyongyang, June 28 (KCNA) -- Some time ago, a ceremony took place to inaugurate the National House of Class Education, newly built on the bank of the River Pothong in Pyongyang as an anti-imperialist, anti-U.S. class education center.
					 Among those present at the ceremony was an armless woman, who is Labor Hero Ri Ok Hui, a lecturer of the National House of Class Education.
					
					 She told KCNA:
					
					 At the time of the Korean War (1950-1953), my mother allowed me to go back to the village, judging that the Yankees would not attack me as I was seven. 
					
					 I, too, begged for mercy when they took me.
					
					 But, the Yankees brutally killed my father and many other villagers and fired bullets on my wrists when I was crying for my father. And they cut off my bleeding hands and arms without mercy.
					
					 Since then I've felt revenge on the U.S. imperialist wolves. So I married an officer of a frontline unit after graduating a university under the benefits of the state. 
					
					 When I became a mother of four children, I named them Kim Pok Su, Kim Ha, Kim Ri Ra and Kim Won Dae, meaning "We will take revenge upon the enemy through generations", and let all of them serve in the Korean People's Army.
					
					 I am now over 70, and I have been engaged in the work of anti-U.S. and class education for more than 50 years.
					
					 The U.S. imperialist brutes attempted to make me suffer torment more than dead for life, but I've lived on revenge upon the enemy.
					
					 I will never quit the stage of warfare for revenge as long as the enemies seek to invade our country again and until they are annihilated to the last one.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Calls for Paving Wide Avenue to Building of Socialist Economic Giant
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Calls for Paving Wide Avenue to Building of Socialist Economic Giant
 Pyongyang, June 28 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un clearly indicated the strategic line of building the socialist economic giant and tasks to implement it and newly set forth the five-year strategy for the state economic development in his report to the Seventh Congress of the Workers' Party of Korea on the Work of the Central Committee.
					 The objective of this five-year strategy is to lay the foundations for the sustainable development of the country's economy by reenergizing the overall national economy and keeping a balance among economic sectors.
					
					 Rodong Sinmun Tuesday in an editorial clarifies the strategy as a scientific one to bring about a great surge in building an economic giant in conformity with the law-governed requirements and realistic conditions of building the socialist economy.
					
					 It goes on:
					
					 Kim Jong Un indicated tasks and ways ranging from the issues of focusing the state efforts on the settlement of the electricity problem and radically developing the coal and metal industries and the railway transport to the issue of properly enforcing the system of managing the socialist enterprises in a responsible manner. All of them are the best proposal based on a correct analysis and scientific calculation of the realistic conditions and possibility of economic construction in the country.
					
					 The practical significance of the strategy lies in making a breakthrough by concentrating efforts on the main link, in boosting overall national economy and promoting the steady development of the economy.
					
					 Our economy can retain great dynamism and the building of a socialist power make a victorious advance only when the above-said five-year strategy is implemented.
					
					 Only when we successfully attain the goals set by the party congress in all sectors of national economy, will  the revolutionary feats the great leaders performed by exerting great efforts for the economic development of the country shed their eternal rays  and a new leap forward be made in building an economic giant.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Denounces U.S. for Regarding DPRK's Nuclear Issue as Bargaining Chip
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Denounces U.S. for Regarding DPRK's Nuclear Issue as Bargaining Chip
 Pyongyang, June 28 (KCNA) -- U.S. and various other countries which have keen interests in Northeast Asia, chime in with each other's claim that the Korean peninsula issue is the nuclear issue of the DPRK.
					 The U.S. political circles say that they can never change the position on "forcing north Korea to dismantle its nukes" under any circumstances and reel off sophism that the purpose of imposing sanctions on the DPRK is to pressurize it to come out to dialogue for denuclearization.
					
					 Commenting on this, Rodong Sinmun Tuesday notes that it is ridiculous for the U.S. to have such a way of thinking as regarding the DPRK's nuclear issue as a so-called bargaining chip as it disappeared from the negotiating table long ago, and the U.S. talk about peace is more ridiculous.
					
					 The DPRK's access to nukes was an inevitable option for self-defence to safeguard its vital rights, when seeing the tragedies in the countries which fell victim to aggression after dismantling their war deterrence built with much effort and in the international arena in which the high-handed practices based on the U.S.-style "logic of strength" are rampant, the commentary notes, and goes on:
					
					 The U.S. is resorting to an undisguised nuclear blackmail against the DPRK after massively deploying nuclear strike means in south Korea and is pressurizing the latter to dismantle its nukes. This is nothing but sophism of a gangster.
					
					 The only way to avert a war on the Korean peninsula is to keep the balance of forces now that there is no elementary trust in the rival except for deep-rooted distrust and hostility.
					
					 Strength can be controlled only by force and nukes can be dismantled only by nukes.
					
					 The DPRK will root out the danger of the outbreak of the second Korean war to be forced by the U.S. and defend the peace of the peninsula and the world by dint of powerful nuclear deterrence. 
					
					 The DPRK is keenly aware of its noble mission as a peace champion. As long as nuclear threat and arbitrary practices of the imperialists persist, the DPRK will further bolster up its self-defensive nuclear force both in quality and quantity, always holding fast to the strategic line of simultaneously pushing forward economic construction and the building of nuclear force.

articles.title: Minju Joson Slams S. Korean Puppet Group for Justifying Anti-DPRK Confrontation Policy
articles.content:
Minju Joson Slams S. Korean Puppet Group for Justifying Anti-DPRK Confrontation Policy
 Pyongyang, June 28 (KCNA) -- Park Geun Hye of south Korea summoned riffs-raffs to Chongwadae on June 22 and blustered she would "not have normal relations with the north unless it stops provocations," taking issue with its access to nuclear weapons. 
					 Prior to this, mandarins of the puppet Ministry of Unification asserted in a "document on the stand on the June 15 joint declaration" that the north's access to nuclear weapons lays big hurdles in the way of north-south relations and peace on the Korean peninsula.
					
					 Minju Joson Tuesday observes in a commentary in this regard:
					
					 This is a shameless scheme of the south Korean puppet authorities to pass the buck for having pushed the north-south relations to catastrophe to the north and justify their anti-DPRK confrontation policy and a mockery and provocation against the main spirit of the north-south agreements, 
					
					 The present conservative ruling forces of south Korea are wholly to blame for having scrapped the north-south agreements as they drove the north-south relations to the present lowest ebb.
					
					 It is well illustrated by the fact that the present conservative ruling forces have been hell-bent on sycophancy towards the U.S. and confrontation with the fellow countrymen in the north since the very day they came to power and left the north-south relations totally frozen after totally blocking dialogue, cooperation and exchange in wanton violation of all the precious agreements reached between the north and the south.
					
					 They are the arch criminals who have put the Korean peninsula in the constant danger of a nuclear war by ceaselessly staging large-scale nuclear war exercises in collusion with the U.S.
					
					 We have already given the present conservative forces chances enough  to turn over a new leaf although they have thrown the north-south relations into the mire of vicious cycle and run amuck in escalating the confrontation of social systems in collusion with the brigandish U.S. and Japanese reactionaries, the sworn enemies of the nation.
					
					 If the south Korean conservative ruling forces persistently rush headlong into the confrontation with the fellow countrymen in the north, turning down the offer made by it out of good faith and crying out for "the north's dismantlement of its nukes," they will only meet the nation's severe punishment and a miserable end.

articles.title: Implementation of South-North Declarations Called for in S. Korea
articles.content:
Implementation of South-North Declarations Called for in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, June 28 (KCNA) -- Pak Hae Jon, co-representative of the South Side Committee for Implementing the June 15 Joint Declaration, called for thoroughly implementing the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration at the international seminar on peaceful reunification held in Seoul on June 17, according to the south Korean internet paper Saram Ilbo.
					 The June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration, the programme for implementing it, which are the landmarks for national reunification, are the most fair and aboveboard great programmes to be held fast to by the Korean nation, Pak said, and went on:
					
					 In order to achieve independent reunification, peace and prosperity, all the people should implement the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration irrespective of ideology, ism and political view.
					
					 A peace treaty should be concluded between North Korea and the U.S. in order to have the "Security Law" trampling down the inter-Korean joint declarations abolished and establish a durable peace-keeping mechanism on the Korean peninsula.
					
					 The Koreans will certainly achieve independent reunification, peace and prosperity according to the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration.

Implementation of South-North Declarations Called for in S. Korea

articles.title: S. Korean Newspaper Denounces Police for Their Merciless Suppression of Sit-in Strikers
articles.content:
S. Korean Newspaper Denounces Police for Their Merciless Suppression of Sit-in Strikers 
 Pyongyang, June 28 (KCNA) -- The south Korean internet newspaper Voice of People on Monday in an editorial denounced the puppet police authorities for indiscriminately suppressing the sit-in strike by bereaved families of victims of the ferry Sewol disaster demanding the probe into the truth behind it.
					 The editorial accused the police of raiding the scene of sit-in strike on June 26 and forcibly dismantling tents and other things and taking away four of them. The editorial went on:
					
					 What mattered was the demand for extending the activities of the Ad Hoc Committee for Probing the Truth behind the Ferry Sewol Disaster.
					
					 The bereaved families who had seen the incompetent "government" which failed to rescue even a single one after the ferry Sewol disaster have witnessed this time the despicable act of obstructing the probe into the truth behind it.
					
					 The "government" should recover the least obligation and render cooperation for the investigation into the truth behind the disaster, though belatedly.

articles.title: Korean in U.S. Terms Park Geun Hye Expert on Chicanery against People
articles.content:
Korean in U.S. Terms Park Geun Hye Expert on Chicanery against People 
 Pyongyang, June 28 (KCNA) -- The Federation of Koreans in the U.S. posted an article written by Kim Suk, Korean in the U.S., on its website on June 26. 
					 The article recalled that Park Geun Hye arranged a "reception for persons of merit during the June 25 war" on June 25 at which she staged chicanery against the people, asserting that the "north is taking the dangerous road of isolation and confrontation in defiance of the efforts of the international community for peace."
					
					 Park talked nonsense that the north is escalating the tension through "cyber terrorism" and "threat of provocation," the article said, adding that when something abnormal happens or errors are made in computer network, she groundlessly charged the "north was to blame for them, but she failed to produce any evidence.
					
					 The article urged Park to stop the charade against the people as she is imploring her master U.S. not to pull its forces out of south Korea, taking trousers leg of her master U.S., unable to protect herself.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Work Introduced by Nepalese Media
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Work Introduced by Nepalese Media
 Pyongyang, June 28 (KCNA) -- The full text of President Kim Il Sung's work "Answers to Questions Raised by the Chairman of the Nepal Journalist Association" was carried on the Nepalese newspaper Arpan and posted on the websites of the Nepal Journalist Association for the Study of the Juche Idea and Songun Politics and the Nepal-Korea Friendship Association on June 24.
					 A photo of smiling Kim Il Sung was carried on the newspaper and the websites.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Report to Party Congress Carried on Congolese Newspaper
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Report to Party Congress Carried on Congolese Newspaper
 Pyongyang, June 28 (KCNA) -- The detailed gist of supreme leader Kim Jong Un's report to the Seventh Congress of the Workers' Party of Korea on the Work of the Central Committee was carried on the 20th issue of Congolese newspaper Le Patriot on the 22nd anniversary of demise of President Kim Il Sung.
					 The newspaper also carried a photo of Kim Jong Un making a report at the congress.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung to Be Remembered in Switzerland
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung to Be Remembered in Switzerland
 Pyongyang, June 28 (KCNA) -- A Swiss committee for remembering President Kim Il Sung was inaugurated in Basel on June 22 on the 22nd anniversary of his demise.
					 Martin Lotscher, chairman of the Switzerland-Korea Committee, was elected chairman of the remembrance committee.
					
					 The committee set the memorial period from June 25 to July 10 and decided to introduce the works and exploits of the President and organize significant events such as a remembrance meeting and seminar.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung to Be Remembered by German Party
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung to Be Remembered by German Party
 Pyongyang, June 28 (KCNA) -- A committee for remembering President Kim Il Sung was inaugurated by the Communist Party of Germany on June 22.
					 Torsten Schoevitz, chairman of the party, was elected chairman of the committee.
					
					 The committee decided to hold political and cultural events praising the revolutionary life and exploits of the President on the occasion of July 8.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung to Be Remembered in Cambodia
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung to Be Remembered in Cambodia
 Pyongyang, June 28 (KCNA) -- A Cambodian committee for remembering President Kim Il Sung was inaugurated on June 23.
					 Kong Sam Ol, deputy prime minister in charge of Royal Palace, was elected chairman of the committee under the instruction from King Norodom Sihamoni.
					
					 The committee set the remembrance period from June 23 to July 13 and decided to give wide publicity to the revolutionary career of the President and the feats he performed for the development of the friendly relations between the two countries, in particular and organize colorful political and cultural events.

articles.title: Xinhua Introduces Mangyongdae Schoolchildren's Palace
articles.content:
Xinhua Introduces Mangyongdae Schoolchildren's Palace
 Pyongyang, June 28 (KCNA) -- The Xinhua News Agency of China recently released a report titled "Visit to Mangyongdae Schoolchildren's Palace."
					 Recalling that shortly ago, Xinhua correspondents in Pyongyang toured the Mangyongdae Schoolchildren's Palace, a typical all-inclusive center for helping children cultivate talents in the DPRK, the report said:
					
					 It is always of great importance in the DPRK's efforts to attain the goal of education to bring up children to be knowledgeable, virtuous and healthy.
					
					 Students of the primary and secondary schools are learning how to play musical instruments, do calligraphy and dance, etc in various hobby groups, beside receiving an ordinary education.
					
					 The palace completed in 1989 is the cradle for Korean children to receive extracurricular education.
					
					 President Kim Il Sung's autographic proposition is displayed with due respect in its lobby.
					
					 The appearance of the palace has changed beyond recognition after its remodeling.
					
					 Saying that the interior of the palace was designed in a magnificent and gorgeous style in full consideration of the psychological features of the children, the report elaborated on its scale.
					
					 At the palace schoolchildren are taught free of charge and they use educational facilities provided by the state.
					
					 It is visited by thousands of schoolchildren every day.
					
					 The children of the DPRK are treated as kings of the country.
					
					 The universal 12-year compulsory education is now in force in the DPRK and the state covers all expenses.
					
					 The palace is called the "second school" frequented by schoolchildren as they not only practice what they have learned at school but acquire artistic talents and sports skills there.

articles.title: International Meeting Supports Korean People's Just Cause
articles.content:
International Meeting Supports Korean People's Just Cause
 Pyongyang, June 28 (KCNA) -- An appeal supporting the just cause of the Korean people was adopted at the 4th meeting of the International Union of Agricultural and Foodstuff Workers held in Paris on June 16.
					 Noting that Korea's reunification is directly linked to peace and security in Asia and the rest of the world and a pressing matter the solution of which is being urged by the progressives, the appeal said:
					
					 It is the outsiders that divided the Korean nation and it is the U.S. and its followers that have blocked Korea's reunification.
					
					 The U.S. should roll back its anachronistic policy hostile to the DPRK, replace the Armistice Agreement with a peace treaty and withdraw its aggressor troops and war hardware from south Korea.
					
					 The U.S. should accept the fair and aboveboard demand of the DPRK for defusing the danger of war, easing tension and create a peaceful environment on the Korean peninsula.
					
					 The 4th Meeting of the International Union of Agricultural and Foodstuff Workers fully supports the proposal for Korea's reunification made by HE Kim Jong Un, chairman of the Workers' Party of Korea, at its Seventh Congress, which called for holding aloft the banner of national independence and great national unity, ensuring lasting peace on the Korean peninsula and reunifying the country by federal formula. 
					
					 It also ardently calls on all organizations of working people in the field of agriculture and relevant sectors to bitterly denounce the U.S. and its followers' hostile policy toward the DPRK and unreasonable moves to stifle and impose sanctions upon it and to extend positive support and encouragement to the Korean people in their struggle for reunifying the country by the efforts of the nation in line with its independent will and demand.

articles.title: Muscle of U.S. Is Not All-Powerful: Nigerian Body
articles.content:
Muscle of U.S. Is Not All-Powerful: Nigerian Body
 Pyongyang, June 28 (KCNA) -- The Nigerian National Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism posted an article titled "Lesson from Korean war: Muscle of U.S. is by no means all-powerful" on its website on June 22.
					 The article said:
					
					 June 25 is the 66th anniversary of the war ignited by the U.S. to invade the DPRK.
					
					 The Korean war was a war of aggression unleashed by the U.S., prompted by the doctrine of strength being all-powerful, underestimating the young DPRK.
					
					 Its military and technical superiority could not beat the service personnel and people of the DPRK all out, aware of the justice of their cause.
					
					 The myth of the U.S. "mightiness" was shattered to smithereens in the Korean war. 
					
					 The U.S., which bragged it has never sustained a defeat in the history of its wars of aggression, could not but sign the Armistice Agreement little short of a surrender document three years after its provocation of the war.
					
					 This was just the outcome of the war it provoked by mobilizing more than 2 million troops including one third of its ground force, one fifth of its air force, most of its Pacific Fleet, troops from its 15 satellite countries, south Korean forces and even remnants of the erstwhile Japanese army.
					
					 Far from drawing a lesson from its defeat in the Korean war, the U.S. has resorted to ceaseless moves to ignite another war against the DPRK in the post-war period, too.
					
					 Today the Korean nation has become a strong nation that never pardons anyone daring infringe upon its dignity and interests.
					
					 In case the U.S. ignites the second Korean war, its land will be engulfed in flames.
					
					 The muscle of the U.S. is by no means all-powerful.

articles.title: Diputados rinden tributo a Kim Il Sung y Kim Jong Il en colina Mansu
articles.content:
Diputados rinden tributo a Kim Il Sung y Kim Jong Il en colina Mansu
Pyongyang, 28 de junio (ACNC) -- Kim Yong Nam, Hwang Pyong So, Pak Pong Ju, Choe Ryong Hae y otros cuadros directivos del partido, el Estado y el ejercito, asi como los diputados quienes participaran en el cuarto periodo de sesiones de la XIII Legislatura de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, rindieron el dia 28 homenaje al Presidente Kim Il Sung y el Dirigente Kim Jong Il, tras depositar un cesto y ramos de flores ante sus estatuas de bronce erguidas en la capitalina colina Mansu.

articles.title: Premier se entera de labores de unidades de provincia de Phyon-an de Norte
articles.content:
Premier se entera de labores de unidades de provincia de Phyon-an de Norte
Pyongyang, 28 de junio (ACNC) -- El premier de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Pak Pong Ju, visito varias unidades de la provincia de Phyong-an del Norte.
					El premier paso revista al taller papelero de la Fabrica de Fibras Quimicas de Sinuiju, el de hilo de punto de la Fabrica Textil de Sinuiju, la galeria Phungnyon de la mina de nombre homonimo, etc. donde averiguo en detalles las metas de la campana de 200 dias y el estado de cumplimiento de los planes diarios de las unidades correspondientes y convoco las reuniones consultivas.
					
					En las reuniones consultivas se dio enfasis a la importancia de las misiones de dichas fabricas y mina, gran base de produccion de apatita, encargadas en la mejora de vida de la poblacion.
					
					Se refirio a la necesidad de asegurar con suficiencia la energia electrica y el carbon, hacer validos en la presente campana de 200 dias los exitos brillantes alcanzados en la reciente campana de 70 dias, arreglar los lugares de extraccion concentrando las fuerzas en la evacuacion del esteril, sustituir los equipos de extraccion por los nacionales y mejorar en alto nivel las condiciones de trabajo y vida conforme a los requisitos de la construccion de la potencia civilizada socialista y se tomaron medidas necesarias.
					
					Por otra parte, al recorrer la Fabrica Quimica de Ponghwa, Pak hablo de la importancia del proceso de produccion con poca energia y discutio los problemas para mantener la independencia y el espiritu jucheano de la economia nacional.
					
					Con anterioridad, el premier habia visitado el campo de construccion de la Fabrica de Oxigeno de Salud Publica y el Hospital de Pediatria Okryu.

articles.title: En Pyongyang enviado especial de Raul Castro
articles.content:
En Pyongyang enviado especial de Raul Castro
Pyongyang, 28 de junio (ACNC) -- Llegaron el dia 28 a esta capital el enviado especial de Raul Castro Ruz, Primer Secretario del Comite Central del Partido Comunista de Cuba, Salvador Antonio Valdes Mesa, miembro del Buro Politico del CC del PCC y vicepresidente del Consejo de Estado de la Republica de Cuba, y su comitiva.

articles.title: Choe Ryong Hae se reune con enviado especial de Raul Castro Ruz
articles.content:
Choe Ryong Hae se reune con enviado especial de Raul Castro Ruz
Pyongyang, 28 de junio (ACNC) -- El miembro del Presidium del Buro Politico y vicepresidente del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Choe Ryong Hae, se reunio el dia 28 en el capitalino Palacio de los Congresos Mansudae con el enviado especial de Raul Castro Ruz, Primer Secretario del CC del Partido Comunista de Cuba, Salvador Antonio Valdes Mesa, miembro del Buro Politico del CC del PCC y vicepresidente del Consejo de Estado de la Republica de Cuba y su comitiva.

articles.title: CC de PTC ofrece banquete en honor de enviado especial de Raul Castro Ruz
articles.content:
CC de PTC ofrece banquete en honor de enviado especial de Raul Castro Ruz
Pyongyang, 28 de junio (ACNC) -- El Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea ofrecio el dia 28 un banquete en honor del enviado especial del Primer Secretario del Comite Central del Partido Comunista de Cuba y su comitiva, de visita en la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea.
					A la recepcion fueron invitados el enviado especial de Raul Castro Ruz, Primer Secretario del CC del PCC, Salvador Antonio Valdes Mesa, miembro del Buro Politico del CC del PCC y vicepresidente del Consejo de Estado de la Republica de Cuba y su comitiva y los miembros de la Embajada de la Republica de Cuba en la RPDC.
					
					Estuvieron presentes Ri Su Yong, miembro del Buro Politico y vicepresidente del CC del PTC, Ri Chang Gun, subjefe de Departamento de CC de PTC, Sin Hong Chol, viceministro de Relaciones Exteriores, Ri Kwang Gun, viceministro de Relaciones Economicas con el Extranjero y otros funcionarios coreanos.
					
					Ri Su Yong dijo en su discurso que el Presidente Kim Il Sung y el Dirigente Kim Jong Il prepararon junto con Fidel Castro Ruz y Raul Castro Ruz las relaciones tradicionales de amistad y cooperacion entre dos partidos y dos paises.
					
					Y deseo de todo corazon que bajo la direccion de Raul Castro Ruz, el partido y el pueblo de Cuba logren mayores exitos en la lucha para defender el socialismo, conquista de la revolucion, y materializar la decision del VII Congreso del partido.
					
					Ri subrayo que en el futuro tambien, la RPDC se esforzara mucho por ampliar y desarrollar incesantemente las relaciones tradicionales de amistad y cooperacion con el partido y el pueblo de Cuba, en acato al noble espiritu del Mariscal Kim Jong Un, Presidente del PTC.
					
					Salvador Antonio Valdes Mesa dijo que el Presidente Kim Il Sung y el Dirigente Kim Jong Il enviaron el firme apoyo y solidaridad cada vez que el pueblo cubano sufria dificultades y el Mariscal Kim Jong Un continua invariablemente la causa de los Lideres antepasados.
					
					Menciono que el VII Congreso del PCC subrayo de nuevo la voluntad de nunca abandonar el socialismo, progresarlo consecuentemente y desarrollar continuamente las relaciones solidarias con todos los paises que apoyaron tradicional e historicamente la revolucion cubana.
					
					Y expreso la conviccion de que su visita servira de oportunidad significante para desarrollar mas las relaciones tradicionales de amistad entre ambos paises y subrayo que en el futuro tambien, Cuba consolidara y desarrollara las relaciones con el fraternal pueblo coreano.

articles.title: MINREX de RPDC informa a representantes diplomaticos situacion de Peninsula Coreana
articles.content:
MINREX de RPDC informa a representantes diplomaticos situacion de Peninsula Coreana 
Pyongyang, 28 de junio (ACNC) -- El Ministerio de Relaciones Exteriores de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea organizo el dia 28 un encuentro de informacion sobre la reciente situacion creada en la Peninsula Coreana para los representantes diplomaticos de los paises asiaticos acreditados en la RPDC.
					En la ocasion estuvieron presentes los embajadores de Laos, Camboya, Malasia, Indonesia, Iran y la India y los encargados de negocios a.i. de Mongolia, Vietnam y Pakistan.
					
					Choe Hui Chol, director general del departamento de Asia y Oceania del MINREX de la RPDC aviso la posicion de principios de la RPDC referente a la reciente situacion de la Peninsula Coreana.
					
					El se refirio a que en estos dias, EE.UU. publico un plan de "operacion de preciso ataque aereo" contra los establecimientos y fuerzas armadas nucleares de la RPDC e introdujo en la Peninsula Coreana y sus contornos el submarino nuclear Mississippi y otras propiedades estrategicas de todo tipo llevando a una circunstancia extremada la situacion de la Peninsula.
					
					La causa principal de tal tension consiste en el criterio erroneo de EE.UU. y en el caso presente, este imperio tomo la decision muy indeliberada y estrategicamente erronea.
					
					Dado que el interes maximo del Estado se ve amenazado a causa del incesante incremento de las fuerzas armadas de EE.UU. y la situacion perdura en estado incontrolable, la RPDC aumentara constantemente la capacidad de ataque preventivo nuclear, desarrollara y emplazara continuamente variadas armas de ataque estrategico enarbolando tambien en el futuro la bandera del desarrollo paralelo.
					
					Al tener muy presente de que EE.UU. es precisamente el autor que agudiza la tension de la Peninsula Coreana y empuja la RPDC al fortalecimiento incesante del disuasivo fisico, los paises asiaticos deberan ayudar el alivio de la tension de la Peninsula Coreana, dijo.
					
					El presente encuentro sirvio de importante oportunidad en el sentido de que los representantes diplomaticos de los paises asiaticos en la RPDC tengan la comprension mas profunda de que la belicosa y perversa amenaza y chantaje nucleares anti-RPDC de EE.UU. devienen el origen de la tension de la situacion de la Peninsula Coreana.
